content:
QueryableFilterRepeater Class

In this Article

Provides a templated control that automatically generates the UI to filter table rows for supported column types.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Web.UI.ParseChildren(true)]
[System.Web.UI.PersistChildren(false)]
public class QueryableFilterRepeater : System.Web.UI.Control, System.Web.DynamicData.IFilterExpressionProvider

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Web.UI.Control
  • QueryableFilterRepeater

Remarks

In this topic:

  • Introduction

  • Class Context

  • Declarative Syntax

Introduction

The QueryableFilterRepeater control is used in page markup to automatically generate the UI to filter table rows. By default, Dynamic Data creates the UI for each supported column type by using the default filter templates that are in the ~\DynamicData\Filters directory.

The default templates support foreign-key, Boolean, and enumeration column types.

The following table lists tasks that are associated with the QueryableFilterRepeater type.

Task Description
Create the UI for filtering table rows. Add DynamicFilter controls to create UI using the ItemTemplate property.
Verify whether the QueryableFilterRepeater control contains data field filters. Perform the check in the OnPreRender method.

Class Context

The QueryableFilterRepeater control is designed to work with the QueryExtender control. It must be referenced by a DynamicFilterExpression instance inside a QueryExtender object in page markup.

The following figure shows the steps that Dynamic Data follows in order to implement automatic table row filtering.

  1. The DynamicFilter controls (which are contained in the QueryableFilterRepeater control), pass a column value to the QueryExtender control.

  2. The QueryExtender control uses this value to create the query filtering information, which it then passes to the data source control.

  3. The data source control passes the query filtering information to the data source provider.

  4. The data source provider passes the query to the database.

  5. The database returns the filtered table rows.

  6. The data source provider sends this data back to the data source control.

  7. This control passes the filtered table rows to the data-bound control for display.

Declarative Syntax

<asp:QueryableFilterRepeater   
    ID="string"  
    DynamicFilterContainerId="string"   
    EnableViewState="True|False"   
    OnDataBinding="DataBinding event handler"  
    OnDisposed="Disposed event handler"  
    OnInit="Init event handler"  
    OnLoad="Load event handler"  
    OnPreRender="PreRender event handler"  
    OnUnload="Unload event handler"   
    Visible="true"  
    runat="server" />

Constructors summary

QueryableFilterRepeater()

Initializes a new instance of the QueryableFilterRepeater class.

Properties summary

DynamicFilterContainerId

Gets or sets the ID of a DynamicFilter control inside the template that is configured to be a filter for a column.
ItemTemplate

Gets or sets the controls that populate the QueryableFilterRepeater class.

Methods summary

OnPreRender(EventArgs)

Verifies whether the control contains data field filters.

Explicit Interface Implementations summary

IFilterExpressionProvider.GetQueryable(IQueryable)

Gets the modified query using the current filter value.
IFilterExpressionProvider.Initialize(IQueryableDataSource)

Initializes a new instance of the QueryableFilterRepeater class.

Constructors

  • QueryableFilterRepeater()

    Initializes a new instance of the QueryableFilterRepeater class.

    public QueryableFilterRepeater ();

    Remarks

    Typically you do not use this constructor to initialize a new instance of the QueryableFilterRepeater class. Instead, you specify the QueryableFilterRepeater control in page markup, and the control is initialized automatically when the page runs.

Properties

  • DynamicFilterContainerId

    Gets or sets the ID of a DynamicFilter control inside the template that is configured to be a filter for a column.

    public string DynamicFilterContainerId { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The ID of a DynamicFilter control inside the template that is configured to be a filter for a column.

    Remarks

    If the ID is not set, the default value for the ID is "DynamicFilter".

  • ItemTemplate

    Gets or sets the controls that populate the QueryableFilterRepeater class.

    public virtual System.Web.UI.ITemplate ItemTemplate { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ITemplate

      An object that defines how items in the QueryableFilterRepeater control are displayed.

    Remarks

    The ItemTemplate property defines the behavior that is used to populate the QueryableFilterRepeater control with child controls. The child controls represent the inline templates that are defined on the page.

    Example

    The following example shows how to set the QueryableFilterRepeater control's ItemTemplate property so that it contains DynamicFilter controls to create the UI for each supported column type. 

            
	    <!-- Set the QueryableFilterRepeater control attributes. --> 
            <asp:QueryableFilterRepeater runat="server" ID="FilterRepeaterID">
                <ItemTemplate>
                    <asp:Label ID="Label1" runat="server" Text='<%# Eval("DisplayName") %>' />
                    <asp:DynamicFilter runat="server" ID="DynamicFilter" 
                        OnFilterChanged="OnFilterSelectionChanged"  /><br />
                </ItemTemplate>
            </asp:QueryableFilterRepeater>
           

                <!-- Set the QueryableFilterRepeater control attributes. -->             
            <asp:QueryableFilterRepeater runat="server" ID="FilterRepeaterID">
                <ItemTemplate>
                    <asp:Label ID="Label1" runat="server" Text='<%# Eval("DisplayName") %>' />
                    <asp:DynamicFilter runat="server" ID="DynamicFilter" 
                        OnFilterChanged="OnFilterSelectionChanged" /><br />
                </ItemTemplate>
            </asp:QueryableFilterRepeater>

Methods

  • OnPreRender(EventArgs)

    Verifies whether the control contains data field filters.

    protected override void OnPreRender (EventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      EventArgs

      The event data.

    Remarks

    If there are no data field filters, this method sets the Visible property of the QueryableFilterRepeater object to false. This method is called after the QueryableFilterRepeater control is loaded but before it is rendered.

Explicit Interface Implementations

  • IFilterExpressionProvider.GetQueryable(IQueryable)

    Gets the modified query using the current filter value.

    System.Linq.IQueryable IFilterExpressionProvider.GetQueryable (System.Linq.IQueryable source);

    Parameters

    • source
      IQueryable

      The data source query.

    Returns

    • IQueryable

      The filter.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the QueryableFilterRepeater instance is cast to an IFilterExpressionProvider interface.

  • IFilterExpressionProvider.Initialize(IQueryableDataSource)

    Initializes a new instance of the QueryableFilterRepeater class.

    void IFilterExpressionProvider.Initialize (System.Web.UI.WebControls.IQueryableDataSource dataSource);

    Parameters

    • dataSource
      IQueryableDataSource

      The data source.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the QueryableFilterRepeater instance is cast to an IFilterExpressionProvider interface.
